intro: Astragalus tashqurghanicus, commonly known as the Tashqurghan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in harsh environmental conditions. Astragalus tashqurghanicus is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
